title: India Beat South Africa In Second Test To Win Record Breaking 11th Consecutive Home Series
text:
India dominated the proceedings on day four as they enforced the follow on and then hammered South Africa by an innings and 137 runs.

AP

The win also means India have now broken the record for most consecutive home series wins - now standing at 11.

After dismissing South Africa for 275 overnight on day three, Indian captain Virat Kohli decided to impose the follow on with South Africa trailing by 326 runs.

AFP

Things couldn’t have gone to a worse start for the visitors as Aiden Markam was dismissed by Ishant Sharma in the first over. The hawk-eye showed bowl going over the stumps, with Markam deciding against going for the review.

AP

It was a downward trend from there, the theme that seems to be synonymous with South Africa, as they surrendered yet again, with batsmen showing little promise of improvement.

Dean Elgar was the top scorer with a hard fought 48, as South Africa surrendered again. For India, Umesh Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja picked 3 wickets apiece.

India will now head to Ranchi with confidence and look to make it 3-0.
